18
19#ifndef GETADDRINFO_H
20# define GETADDRINFO_H
21
22/* Get getaddrinfo declarations, if available. Also get 'socklen_t',
23 and 'struct sockaddr' via sys/types.h which are used below. */
24# include <sys/types.h>
25# include <sys/socket.h>
26# include <netdb.h>
27
28# if !HAVE_GETADDRINFO
29
30/* Structure to contain information about address of a service provider. */
31struct addrinfo
32{
33 int ai_flags; /* Input flags. */
34 int ai_family; /* Protocol family for socket. */
35 int ai_socktype; /* Socket type. */
36 int ai_protocol; /* Protocol for socket. */
37 socklen_t ai_addrlen; /* Length of socket address. */
38 struct sockaddr *ai_addr; /* Socket address for socket. */
39 char *ai_canonname; /* Canonical name for service location. */
40 struct addrinfo *ai_next; /* Pointer to next in list. */
41};
42
43/* Possible values for `ai_flags' field in `addrinfo' structure. */
44# define AI_PASSIVE 0x0001 /* Socket address is intended for `bind'. */
45# define AI_CANONNAME 0x0002 /* Request for canonical name. */
46# define AI_NUMERICHOST 0x0004 /* Don't use name resolution. */
47# define AI_V4MAPPED 0x0008 /* IPv4 mapped addresses are acceptable. */
48# define AI_ALL 0x0010 /* Return IPv4 mapped and IPv6 addresses. */
49# define AI_ADDRCONFIG 0x0020 /* Use configuration of this host to choose
50 returned address type.. */
51
52/* Error values for `getaddrinfo' function. */
53# define EAI_BADFLAGS -1 /* Invalid value for `ai_flags' field. */
54# define EAI_NONAME -2 /* NAME or SERVICE is unknown. */
55# define EAI_AGAIN -3 /* Temporary failure in name resolution. */
56# define EAI_FAIL -4 /* Non-recoverable failure in name res. */
57# define EAI_NODATA -5 /* No address associated with NAME. */
58# define EAI_FAMILY -6 /* `ai_family' not supported. */
59# define EAI_SOCKTYPE -7 /* `ai_socktype' not supported. */
60# define EAI_SERVICE -8 /* SERVICE not supported for `ai_socktype'. */
61# define EAI_ADDRFAMILY -9 /* Address family for NAME not supported. */
62# define EAI_MEMORY -10 /* Memory allocation failure. */
63# define EAI_SYSTEM -11 /* System error returned in `errno'. */
64# define EAI_OVERFLOW -12 /* Argument buffer overflow. */
65# ifdef __USE_GNU
66# define EAI_INPROGRESS -100 /* Processing request in progress. */
67# define EAI_CANCELED -101 /* Request canceled. */
68# define EAI_NOTCANCELED -102 /* Request not canceled. */
69# define EAI_ALLDONE -103 /* All requests done. */
70# define EAI_INTR -104 /* Interrupted by a signal. */
71# define EAI_IDN_ENCODE -105 /* IDN encoding failed. */
72# endif
73
74/* Translate name of a service location and/or a service name to set of
75 socket addresses.
76 For more details, see the POSIX:2001 specification
77 <http://www.opengroup.org/susv3xsh/getaddrinfo.html>. */
78extern int getaddrinfo (const char *restrict nodename,
79 const char *restrict servname,
80 const struct addrinfo *restrict hints,
81 struct addrinfo **restrict res);
82
83/* Free `addrinfo' structure AI including associated storage.
84 For more details, see the POSIX:2001 specification
85 <http://www.opengroup.org/susv3xsh/getaddrinfo.html>. */
86extern void freeaddrinfo (struct addrinfo *ai);
87
88/* Convert error return from getaddrinfo() to a string.
89 For more details, see the POSIX:2001 specification
90 <http://www.opengroup.org/susv3xsh/gai_strerror.html>. */
91extern const char *gai_strerror (int ecode);
92
93# endif /* !HAVE_GETADDRINFO */
94
95#endif /* GETADDRINFO_H */
96
